titles.title: Small Business Cyber Training Act of 2022
Small Business Cyber Training Act of 2021
Small Business Cyber Training Act of 2022
Small Business Cyber Training Act of 2022
Small Business Cyber Training Act of 2022
A bill to amend section 21 of the Small Business Act to require cyber certification for small business development center counselors, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.
Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Reported by Senator Cardin with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 393.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Ms. Velazquez moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1687.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1508, proceedings on S. 1687 are considered vacated.

vote.text: Pursuant to section 3 of H. Res. 1508, and the motion offered by Mr. Hoyer, the following bills passed under suspension of the rules: H.R. 8844; S. 198, as amended; and S. 1687, as amended.

action.text: Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to the House amendment to S. 1687 by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
Small Business Cyber Training Act of 2022
This bill requires the Small Business Administration to establish a program for certifying at least 5 or 10% of the total number of employees of a small business development center to provide cybersecurity planning assistance to small businesses.
